intro: Tsiangia hongkongensis, commonly known as Hong Kong tsiangia, is a flowering plant native to southern China and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has a relatively short stature, usually reaching heights of less than one meter. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
